v8:item.v8:content: Service data used by mail clients. A hidden attribute.
Indicates whether the item has attachments.
Message ID on the email server. A hidden attribute.
ID of the message this mail is a reply-to. A hidden attribute.
Client-side ID of this mail message. A hidden attribute.
ID of this mail message assigned by the IMAP server. A hidden attribute.
IDs of messages that belong to the same thread this mail belongs to. A hidden attribute.
User responsible for handling the message.
Current status of the mail message.
HTML text of the message if the message format is HTML. The message text is stored in the Text attribute.
Message format: HTML or plain text.
The email account for the outgoing mail
Interaction this Outgoing mail is based on.
Indicates whether to request a delivery receipt.
Indicates whether to request a read receipt.
Indicates whether to show the original message in replies and forwards.
Indicates whether to include the original message in message replies and forwards.
Indicates whether to delete this message from the infobase after it is sent away.
Message size in bytes. A hidden attribute.
Date when the message will be sent automatically.
Latest date the message must be sent. Leave empty if there's no deadline.
ID of this mail message assigned by the IMAP server. A hidden attribute.
The hash sum of the email header. An internal attribute.
Reference to the contact in the Address Book.
Email addresses of the Cc recipients.
Reference to the contact in the Address Book.
Email addresses of the reply recipients.
Reference to the contact in the Address Book.
Email addresses of the Bcc recipients.
Reference to the contact in the Address Book.

A number that corresponds to a set of rows in the Access value sets table. Access values with the same set number are checked using logical AND, while access values with different set numbers are checked using logical OR.

Properties.Name: AccessValue
Properties.Comment: Empty values must be allowed to avoid errors when writing objects to be checked

v8:item.v8:content: A reference to a company, counterparty, etc.
Refines an Access value: • For a metadata object ID, it specifies the verification: If null reference, "Update"; otherwise, "Read". • For a rights owner, it specifies the table to select rights from.
Use numbered sets to verify right to Read.
Use numbered sets to verify right to Edit.
Text of the additional String attribute.
Name of a rejected mail attachment.
Mail messages from this infobase attached to this message.
A mail message attached to this message.
Number of this attachment in the list of attachments.
